description: From Latin replicātus, past participle of replicāre (“to fold or bend back; reply”), from re (“back”) + plicāre (“to fold”); see ply. Doublet of reply and replica.

adjectives.description: replicate (comparative more replicate, superlative most replicate)

entries.meaning: (botany, zoology) Folded over or backward; folded back upon itself.
examples: the replicate margin of a shell

entries.meaning: The outcome of a replication procedure; an exact copy or replica.
(music) A tone that is one or more octaves away from a given tone.

verbs.description: replicate (third-person singular simple present replicates, present participle replicating, simple past and past participle replicated)

examples: On entering a host cell, a virus will start to replicate.

entries.meaning: (sciences) To repeat (an experiment or trial) with a consistent result.
